DataElement.preferredName: BCR/ABL1 Fusion Gene Translocation Breakpoint Present Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the BCR/ABL1 fusion gene breakpoint that was present.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: BCR/ABL1 Fusion Gene Translocation Breakpoint Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A fusion gene that results from a translocation t(9;22)(q34;q11) that fuses the 5' part of the BCR gene to the 5' side of exon 2 of the ABL1 gene. There are 3 potential products that are formed depending on which BCR exon has the breakpoint. All of the protein products have constitutively active tyrosine kinase activity. This fusion is associated with both chronic myeloid leukemia and acute lymphoblastic leukemia._The point on a chromosome where the normal DNA sequence is juxtaposed with DNA from another chromosome.  Usually expressed as a band number designation (eg. t(9;22) (q34;q11) Philadelphia Chromosome)_Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Usually expressed as a band number designation (eg. t(9;22) (q34;q11) Philadelphia Chromosome)

Property.preferredDefinition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position (locus) on a particular chromosome, is capable of reproducing itself exactly at each cell division, and directs the formation of a protein or other product. The gene as a functional unit consists of a discrete segment of a giant DNA molecule containing the purine (adenine and guanine) and pyrimidine (cytosine and thymine) bases in the ordered and correct sequence that encodes a specific functional product (i.e., a protein or RNA molecule).

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: BCR/ABL1 Fusion Gene p230 Translocation Breakpoint

ValueMeaning.preferredName: BCR/ABL1 Fusion Gene p230 Translocation Breakpoint
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A fusion gene that results from a chromosomal translocation t(9;22)(q34;q11) that fuses exon 19 of the BCR gene to the 5' side of exon 2 of the ABL1 gene. This rearrangement is associated with chronic myelogenous leukemia.: The point on a chromosome where the normal DNA sequence is juxtaposed with DNA from another chromosome.  Usually expressed as a band number designation (eg. t(9;22) (q34;q11) Philadelphia Chromosome)

Concepts.definition: A fusion gene that results from a chromosomal translocation t(9;22)(q34;q11) that fuses exon 19 of the BCR gene to the 5' side of exon 2 of the ABL1 gene. This rearrangement is associated with chronic myelogenous leukemia.
The point on a chromosome where the normal DNA sequence is juxtaposed with DNA from another chromosome.  Usually expressed as a band number designation (eg. t(9;22) (q34;q11) Philadelphia Chromosome)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: BCR/ABL1 Fusion Gene p210 Translocation Breakpoint

ValueMeaning.preferredName: BCR/ABL1 Fusion Gene p210 Translocation Breakpoint
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A fusion gene that results from a chromosomal translocation t(9;22)(q34;q11) that fuses the 5' part of the BCR gene between exons 12 and 16 to the 5' side of exon 2 of the ABL1 gene. This rearrangement is associated with chronic myelogenous leukemia, acute lymphoblastic leukemia and acute myeloid leukemia.: The point on a chromosome where the normal DNA sequence is juxtaposed with DNA from another chromosome.  Usually expressed as a band number designation (eg. t(9;22) (q34;q11) Philadelphia Chromosome)

Concepts.definition: A fusion gene that results from a chromosomal translocation t(9;22)(q34;q11) that fuses the 5' part of the BCR gene between exons 12 and 16 to the 5' side of exon 2 of the ABL1 gene. This rearrangement is associated with chronic myelogenous leukemia, acute lymphoblastic leukemia and acute myeloid leukemia.
The point on a chromosome where the normal DNA sequence is juxtaposed with DNA from another chromosome.  Usually expressed as a band number designation (eg. t(9;22) (q34;q11) Philadelphia Chromosome)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: BCR/ABL1 Fusion Gene p190 Translocation Breakpoint

ValueMeaning.preferredName: BCR/ABL1 Fusion Gene p190 Translocation Breakpoint
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A fusion gene that results from a chromosomal translocation t(9;22)(q34;q11) that fuses exon 1 of the BCR gene to the 5' side of exon 2 of the ABL1 gene. This rearrangement is associated with acute lymphoblastic leukemia.: The point on a chromosome where the normal DNA sequence is juxtaposed with DNA from another chromosome.  Usually expressed as a band number designation (eg. t(9;22) (q34;q11) Philadelphia Chromosome)

Concepts.definition: A fusion gene that results from a chromosomal translocation t(9;22)(q34;q11) that fuses exon 1 of the BCR gene to the 5' side of exon 2 of the ABL1 gene. This rearrangement is associated with acute lymphoblastic leukemia.
The point on a chromosome where the normal DNA sequence is juxtaposed with DNA from another chromosome.  Usually expressed as a band number designation (eg. t(9;22) (q34;q11) Philadelphia Chromosome)
